The central ideas we shall be dealing with are these:
We need to do more than develop "support techniques",
"support programs" to help overcome educational and
occupational and cultural deficiencies of the poor;
we need to provide open, reciprocal channels of
access to other, advantaged sectors of the "total"
community for the poor. We need to resolve the
problems of isolation, definitively, through the
use of "two-way" telephonic, and/or, radio communi¬
cations systems. We need to resolve the problems
of creating the necessary "software" materials
which reinforce our uses of the mass communications
media.
We say that this paper deals with more than the
question of whether or not to make systems avail¬
